children.value: Used to display countdown values in real time, supporting millisecond precision.
attribute represents the total countdown time, in milliseconds.

props.code:
import { ref } from 'vue';
const time = ref(30 * 60 * 60 * 1000)

children.value: Set the content of the countdown text through the

props.code: <z-count-down :time="time" format="DD days HH hours mm minutes ss seconds" />

children.value: "DD days HH hours mm minutes ss seconds"
The countdown is rendered once per second by default. Setting the
Customize the countdown style through slots. See the table below for the

props.code:
<z-count-down :time="time">
   <template #default="{ current }">
     <text class="block">{{ current.hours }}</text>
     <text class="colon">:</text>
     <text class="block">{{ current.minutes }}</text>
     <text class="colon">:</text>
     <text class="block">{{ current.seconds }}</text>
   </template>
</z-count-down>

<style>
   .colon {
     display: inline-block;
     margin: 0 8rpx;
     color: var(--z-primary-color);
   }

   .block {
     display: inline-block;
     width: 44rpx;
     font-size: 24rpx;
     color: #fff;
     text-align: center;
     background-color: var(--z-primary-color);
     border-radius: 8rpx;
   }
</style>

children.value: After obtaining the component instance through ref, you can call the

props.code:
<view class="count-content">
   <z-count-down
     ref="countDown"
     millisecond
     :time="3000"
     :auto-start="false"
     format="ss:SSS"
     @finish="onFinish"
   />
</view>
<z-grid clickable :column-num="3">
   <z-grid-item icon="play-circle" text="Start" @click="start" />
   <z-grid-item icon="timeout" text="Pause" @click="pause" />
   <z-grid-item icon="reload" text="Reset" @click="reset" />
</z-grid>

children.value: Whether to automatically start the countdown
Through ref, you can get the CountDown instance and call the instance method.
, the countdown will automatically start after reset
The component provides the following CSS variables, which can be used to customize styles. For usage, please refer to

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
